image.altText: Reserve Bank of Australia

props.synopsis: All eyes are on the RBA today, where the central bank board is widely expected to cut interest rates for the first time since 2020. Follow live.

title.children: Reserve Bank delivers first interest rate cut after 13 hikes

image.altText: A person in a long sleeved white collared shirt and black pants walks into the Reserve Bank of Australia as its doors slide open

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank board cuts interest rates, decreasing the cash rate by 0.25 of a percentage point to 4.1 per cent.

title.children: Breaking: Relief for borrowers as RBA cuts rates for first time since 2020

image.altText: A drone shot of a new housing estate, with houses stretching as far as the eye can see

props.synopsis: Tell us your loan size, term and interest rate and our mortgage rate cut calculator will work out how much you could save as rates fall.

title.children: Use our rate cut calculator to see how falling interest rates might impact you

image.altText: A man with a white cap and black sunglasses walks between a TV cameraman and another man dressed in black.

props.synopsis: From 1961 to 1990, the Catholic Church shunted priest Gerald Ridsdale to 16 different parishes across Australia, enabling him to sexually abuse at least 72 children.Â

title.children: Notorious Ridsdale's death at 90 leaves scores of shattered victims

image.altText: A plane that crashed at toronto airport lying on its back surrounded by snow and emergency personnel

props.synopsis: The plane, a CRJ-900 aircraft, was carrying 80 people when air traffic control confirmed a plane had overturned on landing in Toronto.

title.children: Belts that left passengers 'hanging like bats' in Toronto crash 'saved lives'

image.altText: A plane flipped on its roof, with several people pictured nearby. It is surrounded by snow.

props.synopsis: Multiple people have been injured after a commercial flight crashed at an airport in Toronto, Canada, with the plane eventually coming to rest upside down.

title.children: 'It's upside down': Three people critical after Toronto plane crash

image.altText: A man holds a woman's head and kisses her.

props.synopsis: A Foreign Correspondent investigation has detailed the decades of sexism and misogyny leading up to the infamous World Cup kiss.

title.children: Infamous World Cup kiss blew lid on open secret in women's football

image.altText: Jenkins looks directly at the camera sadly wearing camo gear and a hoodie

props.synopsis: The short video was posted to YouTube just over a week ago and shows the 32-year-old Australian dressed in green army fatigues.

title.children: 'I would like more freedom': New video of Oscar Jenkins emerges

image.altText: french president macron stands in paris next to a french guard who is saluting

props.synopsis: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said "a US security guarantee is the only way to effectively deter Russia from attacking Ukraine again".

title.children: 'US backstop' Ukraine's only defence against Russia says EU leaders

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese's faces are overlaid onto a blue and red pie graph. Logos of social media companies present

props.synopsis: The election has not been called yet but the battle for votes on social media is already well underway. So which party is ahead?

title.children: TikTok is crucial for Gen Z voters and the PM is losing the battle

image.altText: A drone image showing Macumba Beach in Rio, Brazil, full of people and umbrella shades.

props.synopsis: It is the highest temperature since the south-eastern Brazilian city started a climate alert system just over 10 years ago.

title.children: Rio's hottest day in a decade hits 44 degrees, sending thousands to the beach

image.altText: Pippa Buchanan shows the battery that lives in her shed.

props.synopsis: Households are handing over control of their solar systems in exchange for equipment. Experts believe virtual power plants could play a vital part in our future energy system as the grid struggles to cope with excess solar.

title.children: Households slash power bills by turning into modern power plants

image.altText: Birdseye view of a young girl drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: National test results show just 28 per cent of Year 10 students are proficient in civics.

title.children: Call for 'immediate' curriculum overhaul after 'shocking' civics results

image.altText: The back of the head of a man wearing a cap and glasses, sitting outside. His face cannot be seen.

props.synopsis: Experts and families are warning that the current system to intervene and rehabilitate people who have joined extremist groups is flawed.

title.children: Chris fears his brother may carry out a 'lone wolf attack'. He's pleading for help

image.altText: Novak Djokovic and Jannik Sinner put their arms around each other at the net before a match.

props.synopsis: The doping cases of Jannik Sinner and Iga ÅwiÄtek have left tennis players frustrated by inconsistencies and apparent favouritism shown to stars, according to 24-time grand slam winner Novak Djokovic.

title.children: Djokovic flags lower-ranked players who didn't get same leeway as Sinner

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A young woman wearing a black dress with tubes attached to an IV drip gives the peace sign

props.synopsis: Young people are more than twice as likely to get forms of bowel cancer than older Australians were at the same age, and researchers have a few clues as to why.

title.children: Massive spike in number of young people getting bowel cancer

image.altText: A paper sign taped to a black fence telling people about a childcare centre being shut down

props.synopsis: Genius Childcare at Blair Athol will be permanently shut down by its operators at the end of the month, despite being permitted to reopen by education regulators after addressing cleanliness concerns.

title.children: Troubled Genius Childcare centre to close permanently

image.altText: A render showing victoria park with a new stadium and two indoor arenas surrounded by housing and the cbd skyline

props.synopsis: The Queensland government will finally announce the location of the 2032 Brisbane Olympic and Paralympic Games stadium next month, after years of debate.

title.children: The main stadium for Brisbane's 2032 Olympics to be revealed next month

image.altText: A man with beard wearing white t-shirt with graphic in a backyard

props.synopsis: Rodney Clough has been sentenced to more than three years in jail for submerging his nephew's face in a sink filled with hot water. Taking into account time served, he is now eligible to apply for release on parole.

title.children: Uncle who scalded toddler's face in hot water eligible for parole

image.altText: sign with hedge behind

props.synopsis: The messages were circulated on the instant messaging platform Snapchat by students from Presbyterian Ladies' College.

title.children: 'Disgusted, not surprised': WA students disciplined after social media chat leaks

image.altText: A graphic showing a concerned woman looking at a phone, next to social media icons.

props.synopsis: Some parents argue it's a blatant breach of privacy. Others say it's simply a necessary precaution in the modern world. But what do the experts think?Â

title.children: The only reason you should snoop through your childâs phone

image.altText: Piglets in hay

props.synopsis: A rare but serious mosquito-borne virus that can spread to humans has been found at two Queensland piggeries.

title.children: Japanese encephalitis virus detected at two Queensland piggeries

image.altText: A blackened window with insulation exposed.

props.synopsis: Detectives investigating a fire that killed a 27-year-old woman at Truganina in January believe the arson attack is linked to Victoria's tobacco wars. The woman is not believed to be involved in the dispute.

title.children: 'Faceless and gutless' arson attackers got wrong address in fatal blaze

image.altText: Two farmers, a woman and a man, stand together in front of a farm buggy

props.synopsis: Kepco bought up large swathes of the New South Wales Bylong Valley with plans to build a coal mine. The mine was knocked back years ago, but the company still isn't saying what comes next.

title.children: Farmers demand answers from silent Korean mining company

image.altText: An image of street lights in Dili, Timor-Leste.

props.synopsis: A high-stakes legal battle spanning nearly a decade sees Australian energy company Lighthouse Corporation suing Timor-Leste for $523 million, while the nation hits back with explosive fraud allegations.

title.children: Timor-Leste calls $523m Australian lawsuit 'major fraud'

image.altText: two girls stand together in a street filled with rubble

props.synopsis: Israel has begun receiving MK-84 bombs from the US after President Donald Trump lifted an export block on the weapons that was imposed over concerns they were killing civilians in Gaza. Â

title.children: US sends Israel 2,000-pound bombs that can 'pancake' buildings

image.altText: A pink haired animated character points a spacey-gun at the camera, on another planet.

props.synopsis: This animated film created by an Adelaide couple is making waves internationally and is the only Australian feature selected for the coveted Berlin International Film Festival.

title.children: Lesbian Space Princess takes on the 'boys club' of adult animated comedy

image.altText: A one year old baby sits on the walking frame with an older lady in the background smiling.

props.synopsis: A mum brings her toddler's playgroup together with the local Country Women's Association, with benefits for all involved.

title.children: Nannas and bubs come together for a playgroup that benefits both

image.altText: Police officers stand outside a house that caught fire.

props.synopsis: Fire and Rescue NSW say early indications suggest the cause of a fatal house fire in Guildford is an e-bike battery.

title.children: Sydney man dies in house fire believed to be caused by e-bike battery

image.altText: GFX 5 Tasmania North West fires

props.synopsis: The bushfires on Tasmania's west coast have now burned nearly 95,000 hectares in hard-to-access terrain. Here's how that compares to the devastating fires of 2018-19 â and what comes next.

title.children: Five maps to help you visualise Tasmania's massive wilderness fires

image.altText: Two police officers standing behind a police car with an open steel cage. They are outside a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: NT judges have met to discuss "concerning" waits in police custody amid concerns people are effectively "disappearing into the bowels of the system" as they wait days for bail applications to be heard.

title.children: NT judge says 'tidal wave' of arrests behind 'concerning' custody waits

image.altText: A varroa mite on a honey bee standing on honeycomb.

props.synopsis: While honey producers and beekeepers have ways to treat varroa-infested hives, the bees themselves also have a few tricks up their sleeve.

title.children: Varroa is spreading through Australia, but some bees can fight back

image.altText: Children and some adults on a beach with a row of surfboards.

props.synopsis: After retiring from elite sport four months ago, Emma McKeon has joined humanitarian aid organisation UNICEF to help teach children in Bangladesh how to swim.

title.children: Australia's most decorated Olympian helps teach Bangladeshi kids to swim
